sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: Shared Element Transitions API is a game-changing feature that will enable us to create impressive and elaborate UI animations easily. In this article, Adrian Bece will explore its incredible potential by building four real-life examples from scratch.
articles.title: Delightful UI Animations With Shared Element Transitions API (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: How about a little inspiration boost? Well, we might have something for you: desktop wallpapers created with love by artists and designers from across the globe. They are available in versions with and without a calendar for October and can be downloaded for free. Enjoy!
articles.title: October Vibes For Your Desktop (2022 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Trina Moore Pervall)
articles.description: Throughout the research and design processes, our unconscious biases are the greatest risk to delivering inclusive experiences. From who we include and exclude in our research to how we plan and conduct research to how we analyze findings, it’s crucial that we understand how our unacknowledged biases can perpetuate systems of exclusion.
articles.title: Unconscious Biases That Get In The Way Of Inclusive Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Wix Security Team)
articles.description: In this article, Wix security experts share ten “security by design” principles that emerged from their work in keeping the Wix platform secure. If you’re a developer, these tried-and-true principles can help you build your own secure applications.
articles.title: Building Your Security Strategy (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Onno Westra)
articles.description: The customer journey is not limited to a website alone. Simply by combining the world of website design and telephony, far better results can be obtained for your organization. And thanks to the similarities and mutual benefits, it is an easy step to take.
articles.title: Phone Numbers For Web Designers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Agustinus Theodorus)
articles.description: Frameworks, while helpful, encourage developers to bundle more code in a very minimal setting. Sometimes this can be a lack of understanding of the impact, but at least you can make your site faster. You don’t need a framework for everything, but if you use one, this article will help you use it in the most performant way.
articles.title: Five Data-Loading Patterns To Improve Frontend Performance

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: SmashingConf NYC is back! A friendly, inclusive conference for designers and front-end engineers who can’t wait to learn and be inspired. October 10–13, 2022. Get your ticket!
articles.title: Meet SmashingConf New York 🇺🇸 (Oct 10–13)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Dave Feldman)
articles.description: In this article, Dave Feldman shares his lessons learned and the experiments has done as a multidisciplinary designer-founder-CEO at an early-stage startup. Let’s take a look at what it is that makes a great design process for teams of any size.
articles.title: Lessons Learned As A Designer-Founder

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (William Juan)
articles.description: If you’re considering learning Angular, this article sums up what William Juan wished he knew when he started, including the mistakes made and lessons learned the hard way.
articles.title: Things I Wish I Had Known About Angular When I Started

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Inline validation in web forms is useful when it works, but frustrating when it fails. Too often it leads to an endless stream of disruptive error messages or dead-ends without any chance of getting out. Let’s fix it.
articles.title: Designing Better Inline Validation UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode of the Smashing Podcast, we’re talking about HTML email. Do we still have to design like we would for IE5? Vitaly talks to expert Rémi Parmentier to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 53 With Rémi Parmentier: Can HTML Email Use Modern CSS?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Scanlon)
articles.description: Gatsby has evolved quite dramatically in the last two years. In this article, Paul Scanlon explains what Gatsby can do today, and how he used some of the new features when upgrading his personal website from Gatsby 2 to Gatsby 4.
articles.title: What’s New In Gatsby 2022?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andrico Karoulla)
articles.description: In today’s article, Andrico Karoulla explains how to create a cool draggable effect by listening to the drag events and writing some custom logic inside the handlers.
articles.title: Building A Retro Draggable Web Component With Lit

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Matt Athanasiou)
articles.description: How can companies change their rating and review systems to better benefit users? Matt Athanasiou shares some steps to improve the experience of reviewing literature and other products — while also building stronger connections.
articles.title: Rethinking Star Ratings For Readers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Josefine Schaefer)
articles.description: Do you want to make your new website as accessible as possible? Amazing, that’s a great mindset! Let’s have a closer look at the factors you should take into consideration when choosing a content management system (CMS) in terms of web accessibility.
articles.title: Accessibility In Times Of Headless

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodríguez)
articles.description: In this article, Juan Diego covers the least known yet extremely useful APIs, such as the Page Visibility API, Web Sharing API, Broadcast Channel API and Internationalization API. Together we will see what they are, where we should use them, and how to use them.
articles.title: JavaScript APIs You Don’t Know About

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Kate Kalcevich)
articles.description: In this article, Kate Kalcevich explains when to use ARIA and how to use it properly so that you can use ARIA in a way that’s helpful to the many disabled people who use [assistive technology](https://makeitfable.com/glossary/?utm_source=Smashing+Magazine&utm_medium=sponsored+content&utm_campaign=Upskill&utm_term=Fable&utm_content=Sept2022) to navigate the Internet. Let’s dive in!
articles.title: Making Sense Of WAI-ARIA: A Comprehensive Guide

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Meet “Smart Interface Design Patterns Checklists”, a deck of 166 checklist cards to help you design and build better interfaces, faster. With accordions, mega-drop-downs, data tables, carousels, and everything in-between.
articles.title: Meet “Smart Interface Design Patterns Checklists” (Deck With 166 Cards)
